metadata.title: CVE-2018-11040 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Spring Framework, versions 5.0.x prior to 5.0.7 and 4.3.x prior to 4.3.18and older unsupported versions, allows web applications to enablecross-domain requests via JSONP (JSON with Padding) throughAbstractJsonpResponseBodyAdvice for REST controllers andMappingJackson2JsonView for browser requests. Both are not enabled bydefault in Spring Framework nor Spring Boot, however, whenMappingJackson2JsonView is configured in an application, JSONP support isautomatically ready to use through the "jsonp" and "callback" JSONPparameters, enabling cross-domain requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11040` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.19-1').
